All that changed when Amascut, the Goddess of Rebirth, became corrupted.

She was reborn as The Devourer, intent on consuming every living soul in existence.

Deep within the desert, an ancient tomb has long hidden a great power – and The Devourer is determined to harness it at any cost.

If she succeeds, all hope is lost.
You must traverse the tomb's many obstacles and foil her evil plans...
before it's too late..
Into the Tombs.name: Into the Tombs
Into the Tombs.start: Talk to [[Maisa]] inside [[Jaltevas Pyramid|Osmumten's tomb]] at the [[Necropolis]].

requirements: * [[File:Herblore icon.png|21x21px|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 3 [[Herblore]] (boostable)
* The ability to defend against level 53 [[Jogre]]s and level 46 [[Harpie Bug Swarm]]s.
desc: [[Trufitus Shakaya]] of the [[Tai Bwo Wannai Village]] requires that you collect five special jungle herbs for a potion so he can commune with his Gods..
Jungle Potion.name: Jungle Potion

requirements: *[[File:Magic icon.png|21x21px|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 45 [[Magic]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Mining icon.png|21x21px|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 45 [[Mining]] (if an ironman)
*[[File:Defence icon.png|21x21px|link=Defence|alt=Defence]] 65 [[Defence]] (not boostable)
desc: Life has been quiet at the Sinclair Mansion since you discovered the murderer...
too quiet.

So quiet, in fact, that the family has gone!

Suspicions are running high that the Sinclairs' recent departure is tied to the disappearance of King Arthur and his knights.
But time is running short and clues are scarce, will you crack the case in time?.
King's Ransom.name: King's Ransom
items: *[[Telekinetic Grab]] runes (1 [[air rune]] and 1 [[law rune]]) (can be obtained during the quest)

*Full [[black armour]] ([[Black full helm]], [[Black platebody|platebody]], and [[Black platelegs|platelegs]]/[[Black plateskirt|plateskirt]])—'''Note:''' Trimmed versions of black armour will work. (h) versions will '''not''' work
*A [[bronze med helm]] (can be purchased from [[Peksa]]'s [[Helmet Shop.]] in the [[Barbarian Village]], or picked up inside [[Draynor Manor]] near the exit)

*An [[Iron chainbody]] (Both the [[Iron Chainbody]] and the [[Bronze med helm]] can be bought upstairs in the [[Warrior Guild Armoury]]. If you can't access the [[Warriors' Guild]] you can get an [[Iron Chainbody]] from [[Wayne's Chains]] in Southern [[Falador]], [[Horvik's Armour Shop]] in central [[Varrock]], or the [[Grand Exchange]])

*[[Animate rock scroll]] (obtainable during the quest). Note: if you have it in your bank, either destroy it or take it with you. You won't be able to receive another from [[Wizard Cromperty]] otherwise.

requirements: **The above quests all require the following quests to be completed:
*[[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 54 [[Agility]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Thieving icon.png|21x21px|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 52 [[Thieving]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|21x21px|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 52 [[Woodcutting]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Herblore icon.png|21x21px|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 50 [[Herblore]] (not boostable)

*[[File:Magic icon.png|21x21px|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 35 [[Magic]] (not boostable)
desc: Great Kourend: a land of wealth, comfort and security.
Across its five cities, the people of this Kingdom work to bring peace and prosperity.
However, all is not as it seems.

Beneath this delicate façade lies an uncomfortable truth: the kingdom of Great Kourend is A Kingdom Divided.

Since the death of the last king, [[Great Kourend]] has been ruled by the [[Kourend Council]].
Under the watchful gaze of the Council, Kourend has enjoyed a golden age of progression.

But not all of its citizens are happy, and, spurred by the recent arrest of Councillor [[Sophia Hughes]], allegations of corruption are growing.

However, the political games of the Council may be the least of Kourend's concerns.
A darker power is gathering in the Kingdom - one that could change the face of Gielinor forever....
A Kingdom Divided.name: A Kingdom Divided
A Kingdom Divided.start: Speak to [[Martin Holt]] at the entrance to [[Kourend Castle]] in [[Kingstown]].
items: * Normal spellbook, and runes to cast a [[Fire spells|fire spell]] ([[fire bolt]] or better)
* [[Melee]] / [[Ranged]] equipment (weapons/armour/potions/food) to defeat a level 239 enemy, and a level 168 creature that can only be damaged with Melee.)
* A [[dark essence block]] or a [[pickaxe]] and [[chisel]] (the latter is found at the mine) to obtain one

requirements: * [[File:Mining icon.png|21x21px|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 10 [[Mining]] (boostable)
* The ability to run from [[combat level|level]] 57 [[ice warrior]]s and level 53 [[ice giant]]s could help.
desc: Sir Vyvin's squire is in trouble.
He has accidentally lost Sir Vyvin's ceremonial sword.
Help him find a replacement without Sir Vyvin finding out..
The Knight's Sword.name: The Knight's Sword
The Knight's Sword.start: Speak to the [[squire]] in the courtyard of the [[White Knights' Castle]] in [[Falador]].
items: * [[Redberry pie]] (not [[half a redberry pie]]), (Members can purchase one from [[Romily Weaklax]] in the [[Cooking Guild]])
* 2 [[iron bar]]s (4 if you want your own [[blurite sword]]) (one spawns west of the [[Graveyard of Shadows]] in the [[Wilderness]])

* [[Blurite ore]] (2 if you want your own blurite sword; it is obtained/obtainable during the quest) (If you plan on doing Falador easy diary AND making a second sword, mine a third blurite ore [members only])

requirements: *[[File:Slayer icon.png|21x21px|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 40 [[Slayer]] (not boostable)
*The [[Haunted Mine]] quest is required to access [[Tarn's Lair]].
desc: This miniquest is to kill [[Tarn Razorlor]] and retrieve his diary.
Using his diary on a [[salve amulet]] will enchant it increasing its attack and strength bonuses by 5%..
kills: Level 69 mutant [[Tarn]], followed by a level 69 ghost [[Tarn]]
Lair of Tarn Razorlor.name: Lair of Tarn Razorlor
Lair of Tarn Razorlor.start: Enter the Lair of Tarn Razorlor.
items: *100 [[coins]] required each time you use the banker [[Odovacar]] (optional)

requirements: *[[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 38 [[Agility]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Fishing icon.png|21x21px|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 40 [[Fishing]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Thieving icon.png|21x21px|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 45 [[Thieving]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Herblore icon.png|21x21px|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 48 [[Herblore]] (not boostable)
desc: The most ancient goblin legends speak of Yu'biusk, the far-off land that saw the origin of the goblin race.

Now, one goblin has had a vision of this land and believes it is Zanik's destiny to lead all goblins to live there in peace and safety - but Zanik will not be able to realise her destiny without your help..
Land of the Goblins.name: Land of the Goblins
items: ** An empty [[vial]] and a [[pestle and mortar]] if making the black dye during the quest

requirements: '''Note:''' Only the quest requirements must be met to start this quest. If you do not have the skill requirements, you may be unable to continue at certain points until you meet them.

desc: Only the elite are allowed to call themselves a Legend of ''RuneScape''.
Do you have what it takes to make it into the guild?.
Legends' Quest.name: Legends' Quest
Legends' Quest.start: Talk to the [[Legends' Guard]]s just outside of the [[Legends' Guild]].
items: * Any [[machete (weapon)|machete]] (can be obtained during the quest - a regular one can be found by searching the cupboards next to [[Radimus Erkle]])
* 2 [[gold bar]]s (6 in case you fail or want more [[gold bowl]]s)
* [[Lockpick]] (2 in case you fail) ([[Strange old lockpick]] does not work)
* One of each cut gem up to diamond:
* [[Unpowered orb]] and runes to cast any [[Charge Orb]] once (requires the [[standard spellbook]] equipped - two casts are needed if taking the "long path" during the second fight with the demon)
* [[Charcoal]] (2-3 in case it breaks -- obtainable during the quest if travelling via Shilo Village)
* 3 [[Papyrus]] (4-5 in case one is torn -- obtainable during the quest if travelling via Shilo Village or from the spawn on Radimus's desk)

requirements: *[[File:Crafting icon.png|21x21px|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 31 [[Crafting]] (boostable)
*[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|21x21px|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 36 [[Woodcutting]] (boostable)
*Ability to kill a level 101 [[Tree spirit (Lost City)|Tree spirit]] with limited [[armour]] and [[weapons]].
desc: Can you find the legendary lost city of [[Zanaris]]?.
Lost City.name: Lost City
Lost City.start: Go to [[Lumbridge Swamp]]. Talk to the campers there.
items: * [[Woodcutting]] [[axe]] (you will need to bank the axe before accessing [[Entrana]] -- you cannot use a blessed axe)

requirements: * [[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 13 [[Agility]] (boostable)
* [[File:Thieving icon.png|21x21px|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 13 [[Thieving]] (boostable)
* [[File:Mining icon.png|21x21px|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 17 [[Mining]] (boostable)
desc:
Sigmund is the advisor to the Duke of Lumbridge, but the duke does not always take his advice.

When part of the cellar wall collapses the duke insists the damage was caused by an earthquake, but Sigmund is worried about a monster attack.

If you investigate this mystery it will lead you through treacherous caves to uncover something lost by the Gods for thousands of years..
The Lost Tribe.name: The Lost Tribe
items: * [[Light source]] ('''Note:''' [[Candle]]s, [[torch]]es and [[oil lamp]]s can cause [[swamp gas]] explosions if going off-route, and need a tinderbox to stay lit)

requirements: *[[File:Herblore icon.png|21x21px|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 5 [[Herblore]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Crafting icon.png|21x21px|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 61 [[Crafting]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Defence icon.png|21x21px|link=Defence|alt=Defence]] 40 [[Defence]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Firemaking icon.png|21x21px|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 49 [[Firemaking]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Magic icon.png|21x21px|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 65 [[Magic]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Mining icon.png|21x21px|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 60 [[Mining]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|21x21px|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 55 [[Woodcutting]] (not boostable)
*:'''Note:''' [[Lokar Searunner|Lokar]] will not talk to you if you do not have all of the required non-boostable stats.
*The ability to kill multiple level 111 monsters.
*Access to each of the elemental [[runic altars]] ([[Air Altar|Air]], [[Fire Altar|Fire]], [[Water Altar|Water]], [[Earth Altar|Earth]])
desc: Can you make it to Moonclan Island and make peace between the Moonclan and the Fremenniks?.
Lunar Diplomacy.name: Lunar Diplomacy
Lunar Diplomacy.start: Speak to [[Lokar Searunner]] at the westernmost dock of [[Rellekka]].
items: *A [[guam leaf]] (common drop from a [[Suqah]] during the quest)
*A [[marrentill]] (common drop from a Suqah during the quest)

*A finished [[bullseye lantern]] ('''NOT [[bullseye lantern (unf)|(unf)]] NOR [[bullseye lantern (empty)|(empty)]]'''. If you cannot obtain one, bring means to get to a [[lamp oil still]] instead. [[Swamp tar]] can be obtained during the quest.)

*All elemental talismans or their respective tiaras ([[Air talisman|Air]], [[Water talisman|Water]], [[Earth talisman|Earth]] and [[Fire talisman|Fire]], or an [[Elemental talisman]]), or access to the [[Abyss]], or the [[Guardians of the Rift]] minigame

requirements: *[[File:Firemaking icon.png|21x21px|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 66 [[Firemaking]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Mining icon.png|21x21px|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 72 [[Mining]] (boostable)
*[[File:Construction icon.png|21x21px|link=Construction|alt=Construction]] 35 [[Construction]] (boostable)
*[[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 68 [[Agility]] (boostable)
*It is beneficial to have a higher [[Agility]] level.
desc: My Arm, the troll from ''My Arm's Big Adventure'', must embark on another journey of discovery.

This time, you'll be escorting him to Weiss, a newly discovered troll town in the far north of the world, so he can share his wisdom ''*cough*'' with the inhabitants, in exchange for learning about their inventions.

Life's journeys can take us to some strange places, but My Arm is about to face the greatest adventure of all - true love.
Plus, they'd like him to kill the Wise Old Man of Draynor Village, which doesn't sound like a clever move.
Can you help My Arm get a grip on the situation and woo the fair Snowflake over the objections of her father, Mother? Or will My Arm be left to a loveless life of loneliness?.
Making Friends with My Arm.name: Making Friends with My Arm
Making Friends with My Arm.start: Talk to [[Burntmeat]] in the [[Troll Stronghold (location)|Troll Stronghold's]] kitchen.

desc: A secluded outpost has served the City of Ardougne for generations, playing stage to many exceptional events.
Its current occupant wants to employ your skills to construct its true history before time runs out and history itself is wiped away!.
Making History.name: Making History
Making History.start: Talk to [[Jorral]] in the [[outpost]] north-west of [[West Ardougne]].
items: **1 [[bone]], 1 [[pot]] and 1 [[bucket]] to earn 5 ecto-tokens (you still only need two) ''or''
**4,100 gold for a [[Charter ship]] to [[Port Phasmatys]] (cheaper depending upon where you travel from and if you use [[ring of charos]]).

requirements: Must be able to defeat a level 39 enemy.
desc: The wizard [[Merlin]] has been trapped in a magical crystal by the witch [[Morgan Le Faye]].
So far, King Arthur hasn't been able to figure out how to free his mentor from his crystal prison.
Can you help?.
Merlin's Crystal.name: Merlin's Crystal
items: *[[Bucket of wax]] (obtainable during the quest with [[Insect repellent]], a bucket spawns near the beekeeper)

desc: A woman cries as a man lays dying, desperately they beg you to stop a cryptic killer before their friends suffer a similar fate..
Misthalin Mystery.name: Misthalin Mystery
Misthalin Mystery.start: Speak to [[Abigale]] (or [[Hewey]], who sits next to her) in the south-eastern corner of [[Lumbridge Swamp]], near the [[fishing spots]].

requirements: The ability to run past two level 14 thieves, and one level 26.
desc: A monk's child has had their blanket stolen.
Find the thieves' den and return the blanket, then help Brother Omad organise the drinks for the child's birthday party..
Monk's Friend.name: Monk's Friend
Monk's Friend.start: Speak to [[Brother Omad]] at the [[Ardougne Monastery]] south of [[East Ardougne]].

requirements: * The ability to defeat a level 195 [[Jungle Demon]]
desc: The King of the northern Gnomes, Narnode Shareen, is once again in need of your help.

He recently decided to send an envoy of his Royal Guard, the 10th squad, to oversee the decommissioning of the Gnome owned ship-building facilities on the eastern coast of [[Karamja]].

It has been quite some time since the 10th squad were dispatched and they have been deemed missing in action.

It will be up to you, should you decide to help, to find out what fate befell the 10th squad and if possible, track them down.

If only it were so simple.
Sinister forces have begun to spread through the Gnome hierarchy and threaten to unleash an unknown terror upon the world.
Far across the land, the fires of vengeance are being stoked once again.
Can you unravel the mystery behind the deception? Can you separate the truth from the lies? Can you decide for yourself what is real and what is not?.
Monkey Madness I.name: Monkey Madness I
Monkey Madness I.start: Talk to [[King Narnode Shareen]] in the [[Grand Tree]].
items: * [[Monkey bones]] or [[Monkey corpse|corpse]] from [[Karamja]] (obtainable during quest)

requirements: ***Balloon flight route to [[Gnome Stronghold]] must be unlocked to start the quest.
*[[File:Slayer icon.png|21x21px|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 69 [[Slayer]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Crafting icon.png|21x21px|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 70 [[Crafting]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Hunter icon.png|21x21px|link=Hunter|alt=Hunter]] 60 [[Hunter]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 55 [[Agility]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Thieving icon.png|21x21px|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 55 [[Thieving]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Firemaking icon.png|21x21px|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 60 [[Firemaking]] (not boostable) (for [[Gnome Stronghold]] [[Balloon transport system#Grand Tree|Route]])
It is beneficial to have a high [[Combat]] and [[Agility]] level.
desc:
Glough, the war criminal set on eradicating humans and overthrowing Gielinor, has escaped the watch of the Grand Tree gnomes.

With a history of leaving large-scale conflicts and warfare in his wake, Glough must be tracked down and stopped.
King Narnode Shareen needs your help..
Monkey Madness II.name: Monkey Madness II
Monkey Madness II.start: Talk to [[King Narnode Shareen]] in the [[Grand Tree]]. (You must have '''all the requirements''' to start the quest).
items: *A [[slash weapon]] (to slash webs if you choose the tanking route - [[Wilderness sword]] of any tier recommended for this due to 100% web slash ability).
*The [[Translation book]] from [[The Grand Tree]]. If you have lost it a replacement can be obtained from King Narnode during the quest.

requirements: * [[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 20 [[Agility]] (boostable)
* The ability to defeat a level 70 [[The Kendal|monster]] (can be [[safespot|safespotted]])
desc: Ages ago, a small tribe of people split off from the Fremennik in Rellekka and decided to inhabit the mountains to the east of town.
There they lived as nomads for many years, but now the chieftain of the camp has lost his daughter and will not move on before she has been found.
Has she run away, has she been eaten by trolls, or is there something more sinister going on? Only you can find out..
Mountain Daughter.name: Mountain Daughter
Mountain Daughter.start: Talk to [[Hamal the Chieftain]] in the [[Mountain Camp]] east of [[Rellekka]]. To get in, take the path north of the [[Golden Apple Tree]] and use a [[rope]] on the rock behind the guard (see below for more details).
items: * [[Staff]] or a [[pole]] (obtainable during the quest, [[Dramen Staff]] does not work, but [[elemental staves]] do work)
* [[Gloves]] (excluding: [[Slayer gloves|Slayer]], [[Mystic gloves|Mystic]], [[Ranger gloves|Ranger]], [[Moonclan gloves|Moonclan]], [[Lunar gloves|Lunar]], [[vambraces]], and random event apparel)

requirements: *[[File:Ranged icon.png|21x21px|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 60 [[Ranged]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Thieving icon.png|21x21px|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 50 [[Thieving]] (not boostable)
*The ability to defeat a level 11 enemy with your combat stats set to 20 each.
desc:
It seems at last Arianwyn has need of your skills.

He believes there is more to the Mourners than meets the eye and he wishes for you to find out just what they're up to.
Can you gain the trust of the Mourners?.
kills: [[Mourner]] ''(level 11) (will decrease all combat skills to 20, including [[Hitpoints]])''
Mourning's End Part I.name: Mourning's End Part I
Mourning's End Part I.start: Talk to [[Eluned]] inside the elven woods of [[Isafdar]].
items: *Each of these [[dye]]s: [[red dye|red]], [[yellow dye|yellow]], [[green dye|green]], and [[blue dye|blue]] (can be bought during the quest for 6 coins each).
** You may want to bring additional dyes to collect multiple coloured toads in case you miss when firing the device.
*[[Rotten apple]] ('''must''' be the rotten apple on the ground north of the [[Mourner Headquarters]] in [[West Ardougne]], obtainable during the quest)
*[[Barrel of naphtha]], or 5-9 [[coal]] to make one
*7 empty inventory spaces for the [[Mourner gear]]

desc:
This chapter of the quest takes our hero deep under the mountains of Arandar to put a stop to the evil plans of the mourners.

If our hero is to succeed, they must solve one of the most complicated puzzles in all of Gielinor..
kills: None (but powerful level 73 [[Shadow]]s are aggressive to players inside the temple)
Mourning's End Part II.name: Mourning's End Part II
items: *A [[chisel]] (one can be found in the house south of the Mourner HQ)

*A [[death talisman]]/[[death tiara|tiara]] for regular players and [[ironmen]] with 90+ [[Slayer]], or else [[Mourning's End Part II#The Death Altar|50 junk items]] (for other [[Ironmen]]). A [[catalytic talisman]]/[[Catalytic tiara|tiara]] may also be used.

desc: Old man Sinclair has been found dead in his mansion! Unfortunately, the local authorities are having some trouble figuring out who's the guilty party.
Maybe the unbiased eye of a passing adventurer will be of help..
Murder Mystery.name: Murder Mystery
Murder Mystery.start: The [[Sinclair Mansion]], north along the path between [[Seers' Village]] and [[Camelot]]. Talk to one of the guards around the mansion.

requirements: *[[File:Farming icon.png|21x21px|link=Farming|alt=Farming]] 29 [[Farming]] (boostable)

*[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|21x21px|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 10 [[Woodcutting]] (not boostable) to cut thatches and repair the fence for Tai Bwo Wannai favour, otherwise you will have to kill monsters spawned by other players
*At least 60% favour in the [[Tai Bwo Wannai Cleanup]] [[minigame]] before starting this quest - this will be subtracted from the total favour
**Acquiring 100% Tai Bwo Favour rating is a requirement for the [[Medium Karamja Diary]]. If completion of the medium diary is desired, it is recommended to get 100% prior to starting this quest
desc: Trolls love goutweed.
They love it so much that they've picked it all, and now they can't get any more.
However, in his smelly kitchen in the Troll Stronghold, Burntmeat the cook has heard a rumour that goutweed is growing once again, for anyone who's got the skill to farm it.

Can you teach his young assistant - a simple troll known as My Arm - to grow the precious goutweed? Will you overcome My Arm's stubbornness and ignorance to earn yourself Burntmeat's reward? Dare you accompany My Arm on this uniquely trollish expedition?.
My Arm's Big Adventure.name: My Arm's Big Adventure
My Arm's Big Adventure.start: The kitchen, deep in the [[Troll Stronghold (location)|Troll Stronghold]]. Talk to [[Burntmeat]].
items: *[[Bucket]] (can be obtained during the quest, south of the cooking pot on [[Death Plateau (location)|Death Plateau]])
*3 [[Ugthanki dung]], or the following materials to gather it:
**[[Red hot sauce]] (obtainable in [[Pollnivneach]]) '''or''' the [[Camulet]] (from [[Enakhra's Lament]] quest)

*Several farming supplies, which can be stored by any [[Tool Leprechaun]] and withdrawn from the [[Tool Leprechaun (Larry)|Trollheim Tool Leprechaun]] - except for Supercompost, these may also be purchased from this Leprechaun:
**7 [[Supercompost]] (must be Supercompost, one extra can be used later rather than the plant cure so 8 total) (He doesn't sell supercompost)

desc:
After saving the holy man Drezel, he's seeking some assistance again.
This time he has a special request for any adventurous sorts to search for the Druid 'Filliman Tarlock' and brave the terrors that infest the swamp of Mort Myre..
Nature Spirit.name: Nature Spirit
Nature Spirit.start: Speak to [[Drezel]] under the Paterdomus Temple near the [[River Salve]].
items: * [[Silver sickle]] - either purchase it from the [[Grand Exchange]], or make it with a [[silver bar]] and [[sickle mould]] in a furnace at 18 [[Crafting]]. Ironmen can buy a [[silver bar]] from the [[Silver merchant]] in [[Ardougne]].

desc: The Mysterious Stranger lurks outside of the mighty Theatre of Blood, the centrepiece of Ver Sinhaza.
This shadowy figure has a new request for you – to humiliate a vampyre noble by the name of Lady Verzik Vitur.
Take on the challenges that lie within the Theatre to reach her and bring a blush to her bloodless face!.
A Night at the Theatre.name: A Night at the Theatre
A Night at the Theatre.start: You can start this quest by talking to the Mysterious Stranger inside Ver Sinhaza, south-east of Meiyerditch.
items: *[[Ghostspeak amulet]] ([[Morytania legs 2]] or better also work)

desc: The Observatory in south-west Ardougne has been ransacked by a family of nearby goblins.
Can you help the professor to rebuild it?.
kills: * [[Goblin guard]] ''(level 42)'' (Optional – can simply be trapped behind a column)
Observatory Quest.name: Observatory Quest
Observatory Quest.start: Talk to the [[Observatory professor]] in the [[Observatory]] Reception Room north of [[Castle Wars]].

requirements: *[[File:Firemaking icon.png|21x21px|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 40 [[Firemaking]] (boostable)
*[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|21x21px|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 50 [[Woodcutting]] (boostable)
*The ability to defeat a level 100 monster
desc: Poor Olaf Hradson.
He has to live up to such expectations.
His ancestors sailed all over the world, and now he has to go out and prove himself their equal.
If only he could read a map...
If only he could sail...
If only he hadn't crashed! Can you help a depressed and soggy Fremennik regain his pride, and possibly the lost treasure of his grandfather?.
Olaf's Quest.name: Olaf's Quest
Olaf's Quest.start: Speak to [[Olaf Hradson]] by the isthmus leading to the [[Rellekka Hunter area]].
items: *4 free [[inventory]] slots (10 if not bringing your own ropes)

requirements: * [[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 36 [[Agility]] (boostable)
* [[File:Crafting icon.png|21x21px|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 25 [[Crafting]] (boostable)
* [[File:Herblore icon.png|21x21px|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 18 [[Herblore]] (boostable)
* [[File:Smithing icon.png|21x21px|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 30 [[Smithing]] (boostable)
desc:
If you're new to Shilo Village after solving the mystery (or even if you did it some time ago), you may like to check out Yanni Salika's antiques shop.

He's a busy chap, revamping antique items, checking out new stock from potential adventurers and maybe he'll have a small<sup>(1)</sup> favour to ask of you? Probably nothing particularly large, Yanni isn't a demanding<sup>(2)</sup> person, should hardly take you any time<sup>(3)</sup> at all really, something to do when you have a spare moment.

That's assuming there aren't any complications.

1: - Perception of the word "small" may be open to interpretation.

2: - In a recent vote, Yanni Salika was only voted the second most demanding person in Shilo Village.

3: - As everyone knows, time is relative..
One Small Favour.name: One Small Favour
One Small Favour.start: Speak to [[Yanni Salika]] in [[Shilo Village (location)|Shilo Village]].
items: * The ingredients required to make a [[Guthix rest]]:
** [[Bowl of hot water]] (Obtainable during the quest)
** '''Note:''' The pigeons do not need to be let out of the cages.
* Two of each of the following gems, cut or uncut: (Two of each uncut gem are obtained during the quest)

requirements: Able to defeat or run away from a [[Combat level]] 4 [[gardener]].
desc: Redbeard Frank knows the location of pirate treasure, but he'll only part with the knowledge for a bottle of [[Karamjan rum]]..
Pirate's Treasure.name: Pirate's Treasure
Pirate's Treasure.start: Speak to [[Redbeard Frank]] at the northernmost dock at [[Port Sarim]], just outside [[The Rusty Anchor]].
items: *[[Karamjan rum]] (obtainable during the quest for 30 coins)
*[[White apron]] (obtainable during the quest in Port Sarim at [[Gerrant's Fishy Business.]])
*60 [[coins]] (only 30 is needed if using a [[Ring of charos|Ring of charos(a)]])

desc: The western part of Ardougne has been shut off as a deadly plague sweeps through the people.
However, a young woman who went in to try to help those stricken by the illness has disappeared and her parents have become worried..
Plague City.name: Plague City
Plague City.start: Talk to [[Edmond]], living next to the wall surrounding [[West Ardougne]], north of [[Ardougne Castle]].
items: * [[Dwellberries]] (Spawns in [[McGrubor's Wood]], squeeze through the loose railing, use ALS, or [[Telekinetic Grab]] them. They can be bought from [[Heckel Funch]] or [[Hudo]] in the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]] or grown with 36 [[Farming]].)
*[[Rope]] (Purchasable in the [[East Ardougne]] [[general store]], [[Port Khazard]] [[general store]], [[Ned]], or a spawn in [[Karamja]] general store.)
*4 [[Bucket of water|buckets of water]] (Can be used one-by-one, there is a [[water source]] and [[bucket]] spawn near Edmond)
*[[Hangover cure]] or the ingredients to make one:
**[[Bucket of milk]] (Obtained by using a bucket on a [[dairy cow]], one is north of [[Ardougne]], or bought from [[Hudo]] or [[Heckel Funch]].)

**[[Snape grass]] (Spawns west of the [[Crafting Guild]] or the peninsula north-east of [[Hosidius]]. It can be grown at 61 [[Farming]]. Can also be obtained from killing [[Tribesmen]] in [[Karamja]].)

desc: Ah, the Falador Farm - filled with cabbages, cows, and even a sleepy sheepdog.
A peaceful place, where you can learn to churn butter, give a dog a bone, or purchase various Farming supplies.
What was once a place of happiness, joy and wholesome dairy goods has of late become dominated by a vile presence.
Each morning Sarah wakes to find her crops destroyed, her cows cowering, and her loyal sheepdog looking...

sheepish.

She's had enough, but she thinks she's got the culprit on the trot.
Can you help her track down...
A Porcine of Interest?.
A Porcine of Interest.name: A Porcine of Interest
A Porcine of Interest.start: Read the town [[Notice board (Draynor Village)|notice board]] in [[Draynor Village]], behind [[Fortunato]]'s [[Wine Shop]].
items: * [[Knife]] or a [[slash weapon]] (except [[abyssal whip]], [[abyssal tentacle]], or [[dragon claws]]) (obtainable during the quest)

desc: Recently contact has been lost with the temple to Saradomin on Misthalins' Eastern border.
[[King Roald]] would be very interested to know what has caused this lack of communication, and seeks an adventurer willing to report back to him on the situation..
kills: * [[Temple guardian]] dog ''(level 30) You cannot use [[Magic]].'' A [[Ring of recoil]] will not register that you killed the [[Temple guardian]] without inflicting at least 1 damage.
* [[Monk of Zamorak]] ''(level 30).'' A [[Ring of recoil]] will not allow key drops without inflicting at least 1 damage.
Priest in Peril.name: Priest in Peril
Priest in Peril.start: Speak to [[King Roald]] in the [[Varrock Palace]].
items: * 50 unnoted [[rune essence]] or [[pure essence]] (can be mined by talking to [[Aubury]] in [[Varrock]], after completing [[Rune Mysteries]]. All 50 essence does not have to be of the same type.)
* [[Bucket]] (spawns above the Varrock Castle's kitchen in the north-easternmost room (go to the kitchen, and climb up the stairs))

requirements: The ability to get past [[aggressive]] [[combat level]] 26 [[jail guard]]s.
desc: Prince Ali of Al Kharid has been kidnapped by the scheming Lady Keli.
You are hired to stage a rescue mission..
Prince Ali Rescue.name: Prince Ali Rescue
Prince Ali Rescue.start: Speak to [[Hassan]] in the palace at [[Al Kharid]].
items: *[[Bucket of water]] or [[jug of water]] (obtainable during quest)
*[[Rope]] (can be bought during the quest at [[Ned]] for 18 [[coins]] or 4 [[balls of wool]])

requirements: * [[File:Thieving icon.png|21x21px|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 20 [[Thieving]] (not boostable)
Note: Use "A Favour Certificate" reward from Client of Kourend on Piscarilius for 20% favour.
desc: The gangs of Kourend have recently been uniting under a mysterious figure called the Queen of Thieves, somewhere in Port Piscarilius.
This novice quest tasks the player with infiltrating the gangs of Kourend in order to find the Queen of Thieves..
The Queen of Thieves.name: The Queen of Thieves
The Queen of Thieves.start: Speak to [[Tomas Lawry]] outside the [[Port Piscarilius]] bank.
items: * [[Stew]] ''(Cooking ingredients can be obtained during quest for 6 [[coins]]. Requires 25 [[cooking]]) Or bought from Forester's Arms bartender in Seer's Village for 20gp.''

desc: Everybody needs some body, and the Odd Old Man knows exactly which bits of those bodies he needs.
Can you help him finish his extensive and extremely creepy collection?.
Rag and Bone Man I.name: Rag and Bone Man I
Rag and Bone Man I.start: Speak to the [[Odd Old Man]], located at the end of the northern path in central [[Silvarea]].
items: *8 [[coins]] for 8 [[pot of vinegar|pots of vinegar]] (bring 68 coins if walking to and from [[Karamja]] for boat fare)
*8 [[logs]] of any type (or an [[axe]] to obtain them)

requirements: *[[File:Slayer icon.png|21x21px|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 40 [[Slayer]] (boostable)
*[[File:Defence icon.png|21x21px|link=Defence|alt=Defence]] 20 [[Defence]] (not boostable) to wield a [[mirror shield]] to kill a [[basilisk]] (though not necessary; see below)
*Completed [[Horror from the Deep]] or partial completion of [[The Fremennik Trials]]
*Partial completion of [[Zogre Flesh Eaters]] (recommended but not strictly required)
*The ability to kill several high-level monsters
desc: An archeological bone gathering quest.
Requires the start and/or completion of multiple quests.
Lots of creatures and animals necessary to be scavenged for specific bones, that will then need to be cleaned and given to the [[Odd Old Man]] for his marvelous collection of bone remains..
Rag and Bone Man II.name: Rag and Bone Man II
Rag and Bone Man II.start: Speak to the [[Odd Old Man]], located at the end of the northern path in central [[Silvarea]].
items: *27 sets of [[logs]] (any logs - normal logs can be obtained on the path just below the [[Odd Old Man]]'s hut if you bring an [[axe]]).
*Combat gear to kill [[zogre]]s (an [[ogre composite bow]] with [[brutal arrow]]s or runes for [[Crumble Undead]] casts is advised)
*[[Mirror shield]] or [[V's shield]] (unless using a workaround - see guide for how to get around using this)

desc: Gertrude knows of some ratcatchers in Varrock, pay her a visit and she may tell you of their whereabouts.

Perhaps they could show you and your cat a few pointers about rat catching.

Enter the subterranean world of the rat catchers and discover more of your cat's true potential..
kills: None, but your cat will have to fight the [[King rat]]
Ratcatchers.name: Ratcatchers
items: *Any type of [[cat]] or [[hellcat]] (for most of the quest, a cat with a high successful [[rat catch rate]] is recommended, and [[overgrown cat]]s cannot be used there -- during the [[Ratcatchers#Hooknosed Jack|Hooknosed Jack part]] of the quest, any cat with strong [[Cat#Combat_stats|combat stats]] is recommended)
*[[Rat poison]] (if cheese is not already poisoned; can be found in the [[Clock Tower Basement]]), or made during the quest with the following items:
**Cleaned [[kwuarm]] (grimy will not work; [[Zahur]] in [[Nardah]] cleans grimy herbs for 200 coins)

requirements: '''To start the quest and finish the [[Recipe for Disaster/Another Cook's Quest|first chapter]]:'''
*[[File:Cooking icon.png|21x21px|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 10 [[Cooking]] (boostable)
'''To complete all chapters of the quest:'''
*[[File:Quest point icon.png|21x21px|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] 175 [[Quest points]] (9 are earned for the other parts of the quest, and 79 are gained by completing all required quests)
*[[File:Cooking icon.png|21x21px|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 70 [[Cooking]] (boostable)
*[[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 48 [[Agility]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Mining icon.png|21x21px|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 50 [[Mining]] (boostable)
*[[File:Fishing icon.png|21x21px|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 53 [[Fishing]] (boostable)
*[[File:Thieving icon.png|21x21px|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 53 [[Thieving]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Herblore icon.png|21x21px|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 25 [[Herblore]] (boostable)
*[[File:Magic icon.png|21x21px|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 59 [[Magic]] (boostable)
*[[File:Smithing icon.png|21x21px|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 40 [[Smithing]] (boostable)
*[[File:Firemaking icon.png|21x21px|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 50 [[Firemaking]] (boostable)
*[[File:Ranged icon.png|21x21px|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 40 [[Ranged]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Crafting icon.png|21x21px|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 40 [[Crafting]] (boostable)
*[[File:Fletching icon.png|21x21px|link=Fletching|alt=Fletching]] 10 [[Fletching]] (boostable)
*[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|21x21px|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 36 [[Woodcutting]] (boostable)
*The ability to defeat high leveled monsters, several of which have to be defeated without using [[File:Prayer icon.png|21x21px|link=Prayer|alt=Prayer]] [[Prayer]]
*Completion (or partial completion where stated) of the following quests:
**Started [[Legends' Quest]] up until gaining access to the [[Kharazi Jungle]]
desc:
The cook in Lumbridge has a surprisingly small number of ingredients on hand in his kitchen, possibly as a result of an endless stream of newcomers with light fingers, taking anything that isn't nailed down from his kitchen.

Luckily, in the past, a kind [[Cook's Assistant]] was willing to help him in his culinary duties, but a problem has now appeared that could spell...

a '''Recipe For Disaster'''!

Almost all members may attempt to solve his tricky predicament, and be rewarded accordingly, but only the very elite of Questers will be able to put an end to his problem permanently!.
Recipe for Disaster.name: Recipe for Disaster
Recipe for Disaster.start: Speak to the [[Cook (Lumbridge)|Cook]] in the kitchen of [[Lumbridge Castle]].
items: '''To start the quest and finish the [[Recipe for Disaster/Another Cook's Quest|first chapter]]:'''
'''To complete all chapters of the quest:'''
*About 320 [[coins]] ''(or 120 if you have the activated [[Ring of charos]])''
*[[Bowl of water]] ''(an [[empty bowl]] can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*[[Bucket of water]] ''(an [[Bucket|empty bucket]] can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*3 [[buckets of milk]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*[[Spice]] or [[gnome spice]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*[[Cake tin]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*Any [[cat]] except an [[overgrown cat]] ''(you'll be [[chase|chasing rats]], so a [[wily cat]] is recommended)''
*[[Raw chompy]] ''(several recommended in case of burning)''
*[[Ogre bow]] and several [[ogre arrows]] ''(10 is enough)''
*2 [[pots of flour]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*[[Pot of cornflour]] ''(or raw [[sweetcorn]] and an [[empty pot]])''
*[[Pot of cream]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*[[gorilla greegree|Gorilla]], [[ninja greegree|ninja]] and [[zombie greegree]] ''(or 3000 [[coins]] and combat equipment if making the greegrees during the quest)''

desc: The Temple Knights of Saradomin, a secret organisation founded many centuries ago by Saradomin himself, are currently looking to expand their ranks with some new blood.

After the successful thwarting of the Black Knights' plans to take over Asgarnia, and with the personal recommendation of Sir Amik, you have now been offered the chance to apply for membership in this organisation...
but are you up to the challenge?.
Recruitment Drive.name: Recruitment Drive
Recruitment Drive.start: Speak to [[Sir Amik Varze]] on the 2nd floor[UK]3rd floor[US] of the [[White Knights' Castle]]'s western tower in [[Falador]].

requirements: * [[File:Crafting icon.png|21x21px|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 10 [[Crafting]] (not boostable)
* [[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 56 [[Agility]] (boostable)
* The ability to defeat a level 110 [[Tyras guard]] (can be [[safespotted]])
desc:
Continuing the Plague City series, the Regicide Quest takes you beyond the 'Well of Voyage' to a new realm.

King Lathas will employ you once again, this time for the grim task of disposing of his brother.

Upon travelling to the realm you will find yourself surrounded by new and strange plants, animals and even a new race.

Once there, you will see that everything is not as serene as it first appears..
Regicide.name: Regicide
Regicide.start: Talk to [[King Lathas]] on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of [[Ardougne Castle]].
items: * 5 [[coal]] in the bank (although at least 25 is recommended; you may bring the coal noted to save you a bank trip)
* [[Bow]] and some [[arrows]] (or [[fire arrows|lit fire arrows]] if you already have some.)
* [[Limestone]] (or a [[pickaxe]] and [[File:Mining icon.png|21x21px|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 10+ [[Mining]]). Note that [[limestone brick]]s will '''not''' work.
* [[Strip of cloth]] (made on a [[loom]] with 4 [[balls of wool]]; '''not''' a [[bolt of cloth]] - you can use the [[loom]] at the [[Iorwerth Camp]] or at the [[Falador]] farm)
* [[Gloves]], the list on [[Quicklime]] shows all gloves that work.
* [[Cooked rabbit]] (obtainable during quest if you bring an [[axe]]) or [[roast rabbit]]
* OPTIONAL: Your [[Iban's staff]] or [[Iban's staff (u)|its upgraded counterpart]] in order to recharge it, if you have space available in your inventory.

requirements: Capable of killing or running away from a [[combat level]] 13 [[skeleton]].
desc: A ghost is haunting [[Lumbridge]] graveyard.
The priest of the Lumbridge church of [[Saradomin]] wants you to find out how to get rid of it..
The Restless Ghost.name: The Restless Ghost
The Restless Ghost.start: Speak to [[Father Aereck]] in the chapel south-east of [[Lumbridge Castle]].

desc: [[Romeo]] and [[Juliet]] are desperately in love, but Juliet's father doesn't approve.
Help them to find a way to get married and live happily ever after..
Romeo & Juliet.name: Romeo & Juliet

requirements: * The ability to defeat a level 84 enemy unarmed, with [[Glarial's Tomb#Restricted items|heavy restrictions]]
* [[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 56 [[Agility]] (boostable), unless travelling with a [[charter ship]] to the elven woods
desc: Deep in the elven forests of Isafdar, live a duo of roving elves: Islwyn a grumpy, old elf who dislikes humans and his companion, [[Eluned]], who is a beautiful, friendly, young female elf with a kind heart.
In this quest, you are challenged to overcome Islwyn's prejudice against humans and alleviate the burdens of the past..
kills: * [[Moss Guardian]] ''(level 84)'' (has to be killed with [[Glarial's Tomb#Restricted items|restricted items]], can be [[flinched]])
Roving Elves.name: Roving Elves
Roving Elves.start: Talk to [[Islwyn]] inside the elven woods of [[Isafdar]].
items: * [[Glarial's pebble]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Key (Waterfall Dungeon)|Key]] (can be obtained during the quest)

requirements: *[[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 40 [[Agility]] (boostable)
*[[File:Slayer icon.png|21x21px|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 40 [[Slayer]] (boostable)
desc: It's tough being a regent of a small island kingdom, especially when the [[King Vargas|king]] has declared war while you were adventuring.
Something is up in [[Miscellania]] and [[Etceteria]], so you'd better find out what before both kingdoms end up in royal trouble..
Royal Trouble.name: Royal Trouble
Royal Trouble.start: Go to [[Miscellania]] and speak to [[Advisor Ghrim]] in the castle.
items: *5 [[coal]] (obtainable during the quest with a [[pickaxe]], which will also be obtainable)
*1 [[plank]] (obtainable from a spawn during the quest)

requirements: *[[File:Crafting icon.png|21x21px|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 42 [[Crafting]] (boostable)
*[[File:Fishing icon.png|21x21px|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 50 [[Fishing]] (boostable)
*[[File:Farming icon.png|21x21px|link=Farming|alt=Farming]] 40 [[Farming]] (boostable)
*[[File:Prayer icon.png|21x21px|link=Prayer|alt=Prayer]] 47 [[Prayer]] (boostable)
*[[File:Slayer icon.png|21x21px|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 42 [[Slayer]] (not boostable)
*The ability to kill a [[combat level]] 150 [[Evil spirit|monster]] (can be [[safespotted]])
desc: Zombie pirates have arisen on [[Braindeath Island]], and they don't look friendly! Production of 'rum' has stopped, and the pirate brewers are running scared.
Can you overcome the horde of drunken, undead pirates? Can you even get to the island without getting a splitting headache?.
Rum Deal.name: Rum Deal
Rum Deal.start: [[Pirate Pete]], at a dock due north of [[Port Phasmatys]].
items: *At least 47 [[prayer points]] for the ''[[Rum Deal#Evil spirits|Evil spirits]]'' part of the quest

desc: Recent research at the [[Wizards' Tower]] has found a way to create Runes for the first time in centuries.
Assist the head wizard Sedridor in his research and he too may teach you these secrets!.
Rune Mysteries.name: Rune Mysteries
Rune Mysteries.start: Speak to [[Duke Horacio]] on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of [[Lumbridge Castle]].

requirements: * [[File:Prayer icon.png|21x21px|link=Prayer|alt=Prayer]] 31 [[Prayer]] (not boostable)
* The ability to run past level 172 [[black demon]]s and level 64 [[poison spider]]s
desc: Thormac the Sorcerer has a hobby involving scorpions.
Unfortunately, three of them have escaped and managed to run far away.
If you manage to find them all, he may just be able to perform an important service for you..
kills: * [[Jailer]] ''(level 47)'' if you need to acquire the [[dusty key]]
Scorpion Catcher.name: Scorpion Catcher
Scorpion Catcher.start: Speak to [[Thormac]] at the top floor of the [[Sorcerer's Tower]], south-east of the [[Ranging Guild]].
items: *[[Dusty key]] (obtainable during the quest) or [[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 70 [[Agility]] (boostable).

requirements: * [[File:Firemaking icon.png|21x21px|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 30 [[Firemaking]] (boostable)
desc:
Something strange is happening on the [[Fishing Platform]].
Missing fishermen and the presence of dozens of strange sea creatures gives cause for concern.
Investigate the platform, discover the truth before it's too late..
Sea Slug.name: Sea Slug
items: * [[Swamp paste]] (made by mixing [[flour]] with [[swamp tar]] then cooking the mixture on a fire; can also be bought from a [[Trader crewmember]] for 75 coins, from [[Rasolo]] for 60 coins west of the [[Fishing Guild]], or from the [[Khazard General Store]] for 42 coins at full stock)

requirements: *[[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 69 [[Agility]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Thieving icon.png|21x21px|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 64 [[Thieving]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Hunter icon.png|21x21px|link=Hunter|alt=Hunter]] 56 [[Hunter]] (not boostable)
***[[Curse of the Empty Lord]], for full [[ghostly robes]]
****Started [[Desert Treasure I]], for the [[ring of visibility]]
desc: Our story begins - as all good murder mysteries do - with a mysterious murder, and there's no shortage of suspects - in fact, you're one of them! Be prepared to form an uneasy alliance, dig up secrets best left buried deep, and walk away with more questions than answers....
Secrets of the North.name: Secrets of the North
Secrets of the North.start: The [[Carnillean Mansion]] in the south-west corner of [[East Ardougne]]

requirements: * Completion of [[File:Quest point icon.png|21x21px|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]]  [[Priest in Peril]]
* [[File:Crafting icon.png|21x21px|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 20 [[Crafting]] (boostable)
* [[File:Herblore icon.png|21x21px|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 15 [[Herblore]] (boostable)
* [[File:Firemaking icon.png|21x21px|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 5 [[Firemaking]] (boostable)
* Must be able to defeat 5 level-40 [[Loar Shade]]s.
* Must be able to survive an onslaught when rebuilding the Temple, and being surrounded by many players makes this much easier.
desc: The townsfolk of [[Mort'ton]] have some form of strange affliction and the town is full of Shades.
Can you find some way to reverse this?.
Shades of Mort'ton.name: Shades of Mort'ton
Shades of Mort'ton.start: Find the [[Diary (Shades of Mort'ton)|Diary of Herbi Flax]] on a shelf in a house at the village of [[Mort'ton]].
items: * 5000+ [[coins]] (bring plenty of money just in case)
* 2 [[Tarromin potion (unf)]] (made by adding 2 clean [[Tarromin]]s (obtainable during quest) to 2 [[Vial of water|vials of water]] (empty vials are obtainable during quest))

* Prior to building the temple, you need a [[hammer]] (1 coin at the [[general store]]). However, a regular hammer is insufficient to build the temple without a large group. An additional 13,000 coins (or 5,336 on the [[Grand Exchange]]) allows you to buy a [[Flamtaer hammer]] from Razmire, which is necessary to complete this part of the [[quest]] without a group.

requirements: *[[File:Crafting icon.png|21x21px|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 30 [[Crafting]] (boostable)
*The ability to defeat a level 100 demon
desc: A sinister group of dark wizards is attempting to summon Agrith-Naar, a demon of exceptional mystical power.

Rather than try to prevent them, a Saradominist priest asks the player to help summon the demon and then kill it once and for all.

But all is not as it seems....
Shadow of the Storm.name: Shadow of the Storm
Shadow of the Storm.start: Speak to [[Father Reen]], south of [[Al-Kharid]] bank.
items: *Any black outfit (minimum of 3 pieces, see [[Shadow_of_the_Storm#Starting_Out|below]] for the allowed gear — the dyed [[Silverlight]] '''does not''' count as a piece of black clothing)
**'''Note:''' You can make a [[black desert robe]] and [[black desert shirt|shirt]] during the quest if you brought a [[desert robe]] and [[desert shirt|shirt]]
*[[Black dye]] (from grinding a black mushroom using a pestle and mortar alongside a vial)
*Means to enter the desert (such as the [[Shantay pass (item)|Shantay pass]], [[Desert amulet 2]], [[Teleport tablets]] or [[Teleport scrolls|scrolls]], [[Fairy rings]] or the [[Pharaoh's sceptre]])

desc: Dispose of plagued sheep and save Ardougne!.
Sheep Herder.name: Sheep Herder
Sheep Herder.start: Speak to [[Councillor Halgrive]] outside of the [[East Ardougne]] church.

desc: Fred the Farmer's sheep are getting mighty woolly.
He will pay you to shear them..
Sheep Shearer.name: Sheep Shearer
Sheep Shearer.start: Speak to [[Fred the Farmer]] in the house by the [[sheep]] pen north of [[Lumbridge Castle]].
items: *[[Shears]] to obtain [[wool]] to spin into balls of wool (obtained during the quest)

requirements: A trustworthy friend or partner. Players can join the official [[chat-channel]] "OSRS SOA" to look for a partner.
desc: Varrockian literature tells of a valuable shield, stolen long ago from the museum of [[Varrock]], by a gang of professional thieves.
See if you can track down this shield and return it to the museum.
You will need a friend to help you complete this quest..
Shield of Arrav.name: Shield of Arrav
Shield of Arrav.start: [[Varrock]] Palace library. Talk to [[Reldo]], the librarian, located at the northern end of [[Varrock Castle]].
items: *Black Arm Gang: 2 [[Phoenix crossbow]]s (obtained during the quest)

requirements: * [[File:Crafting icon.png|21x21px|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 20 [[Crafting]] (boostable)
* [[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 32 [[Agility]] (boostable)
* Must be able to defend from many [[Undead one]]s (level 61-73) and able to defeat three monsters that are about level 90.
desc:
New areas in the southern part of Karamja Island have been discovered with a mysterious village.
Who knows what hidden treasures exist, and what dangers lurk to guard them?.
kills: * [[Nazastarool]] in 3 forms, levels 91, 68 and 93. [[Safespotting]] is possible.
Shilo Village.name: Shilo Village
Shilo Village.start: Talk to [[Mosol Rei]] outside of [[Shilo Village (location)|Shilo Village]] in the south part of [[Karamja]].
items: * A lit [[torch]] or [[candle]] ([[lantern]]s or [[black candle]]s don't work) (a [[bruma torch]] will work, but '''you will not get this item back''')
* [[Bronze wire]] (can be made from scratch using the General Store and Anvil north of [[Tai Bwo Wannai]])
* 3 regular [[bones]] (obtainable during quest, only ''normal'' bones work; a spare is a good idea in case you bury one)
''All required items (except for the bones and wire) can be bought at the [[general store]] in [[Tai Bwo Wannai]] for less than 100 coins.''
''Bones can be obtained from the [[chicken]] (Level 3) south of [[Trufitus]] past the rotten fence.

requirements: *[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|21x21px|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 62 [[Woodcutting]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Fletching icon.png|21x21px|link=Fletching|alt=Fletching]] 60 [[Fletching]] (not boostable)

*[[File:Slayer icon.png|21x21px|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 50 [[Slayer]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Magic icon.png|21x21px|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 49 [[Magic]] (not boostable)
desc: A darkness has fallen over Morytania.
The Myreque freedom fighters have achieved their first major victory over the vampyres with the death of [[Ranis Drakan]].
However, their newly found hope is unlikely to last.
After many years of absence, [[Lord Lowerniel Vergidiyad Drakan|Lord Lowerniel Drakan]], the vampyre overlord of Morytania, has finally emerged from his castle.
He has but one goal.
To avenge his brother and eradicate the Myreque once and for all..
Sins of the Father.name: Sins of the Father
Sins of the Father.start: Speak to [[Veliaf Hurtz]] outside the church in [[Slepe]].
items: *[[Vyrewatch outfit]] ([[Vyrewatch top|top]], [[Vyrewatch legs|legs]], and [[Vyrewatch shoes|shoes]]) or 1,950 coins to purchase it from [[Trader Sven's Black-market Goods]] (can be obtained during quest)
*Runes for [[Lvl-3 Enchant]] (1 [[cosmic rune]], 5 [[fire rune]]s) or an [[enchant ruby or topaz]] tablet

requirements: *[[File:Cooking icon.png|21x21px|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 20 [[Cooking]] (boostable)
desc: Help a drunken man haunted by the curse of the Mogres..
Skippy and the Mogres.name: Skippy and the Mogres
Skippy and the Mogres.start: Speak to [[Skippy]] located south-east of the town of [[Rimmington]].
items: ***[[Nettles]] (more than one with low Cooking level, as it can fail due to over boiling)
****[[Gloves]] to pick the nettles ([[leather gloves]] are obtainable during the quest)
*[[Hangover cure]] or the ingredients to make one:

requirements: *[[File:Smithing icon.png|21x21px|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 15 [[Smithing]] (not boostable)
desc: Ahh, giants.
We all know them.

Enormous humanoids hanging about Gielinor, simply minding their own business until some adventurer or another comes along to beat them up.

But how much do we really know about these giants? What do they think about? Where did they come from? Would they enjoy making massive swords in some kind of...

gargantuan workshop?

All these questions, and more, will be answered in the quest Sleeping Giants! You'll help Kovac, a friendly giant who's discovered an ancient forge built to his giant-size proportions!.
Sleeping Giants.name: Sleeping Giants
Sleeping Giants.start: Speak to [[Kovac]] at the [[Giants' Plateau]], east of [[Al Kharid]].
items: * [[Hammer]] or [[Imcando hammer]] (Other types of hammers will not work)
* 1 [[bucket of water]] (Obtainable during quest) or [[ice gloves]]

requirements: *[[File:Crafting icon.png|21x21px|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 30 [[Crafting]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Runecraft icon.png|21x21px|link=Runecraft|alt=Runecraft]] 30 [[Runecraft]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Slayer icon.png|21x21px|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 30 [[Slayer]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Thieving icon.png|21x21px|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 30 [[Thieving]] (not boostable)
*The ability to defeat a level 62 enemy with [[Melee]].
*You must have the [[Commorb]] in your inventory to start the quest.
desc: The small village of [[Witchaven]] was all but deserted when the [[Fishing Platform]] was built a short ways off the coast.
Now, some of the inhabitants of the village have been acting somewhat strangely.....
The Slug Menace.name: The Slug Menace
The Slug Menace.start: Speak to [[Sir Tiffy Cashien]] in [[Falador Park]].
items: *[[Commorb]] (can get another by speaking to [[Sir Tiffy]])
*At least 5 [[rune essence|rune]]/[[pure essence]] (bring 15–20 in case they shatter; succeeding with 5 is very unlikely)
*Access to the [[Air Altar|Air]], [[Water Altar|Water]], [[Earth Altar|Earth]], [[Fire Altar|Fire]] and [[Mind Altar]]s
**[[Elemental talisman]] '''OR''' [[air talisman|Air]], [[water talisman|Water]], [[earth talisman|Earth]] and [[fire talisman|Fire]] [[talisman]]s or [[tiara (disambiguation)|tiara]]s
**Travelling through the [[Abyss]] or using a [[Runecraft cape]]

*[[File:Construction icon.png|21x21px|link=Construction|alt=Construction]] 70 [[Construction]] (not boostable)

*[[File:Smithing icon.png|21x21px|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 70 [[Smithing]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|21x21px|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 70 [[Woodcutting]] (not boostable)
desc: Our story begins with you, the hero, answering the call to adventure when Edmond, a resident of Ardougne, asks for your aid.
By rescuing his daughter Elena from Plague City, the quarantined West Ardougne, you begin to unravel the mystery surrounding the disease.
With her help, you discover the plague is a hoax - a plot by King Lathas to section off the West Ardougne.

By confronting him, you find out this was done to protect the rest of Gielinor from the threat in the elven lands.

The king sends you on a mission to travel through the Underground Pass and help his ally, Lord Iorwerth, in eradicating his brother King Tyras who threatens to revive the mysterious Dark Lord.

After an arduous journey through the pass, you meet with Iorwerth and his forces to end Tyras' evil once and for all.

Upon your return to Lathas you are intercepted by Arianwyn, a rebel elf who opposes Lord Iorwerth.
He informs you of Lathas and Iorwerth's deception.
They manipulated you into removing their final opposition and were now free to bring the Dark Lord back to Gielinor for their own intentions.
You work with the elven rebellion to discover the purpose of the plague was to disguise the digsite of the long lost Temple of Light.

An ancient place that is key to bringing back the Dark Lord.

To make amends for your past mistakes and put a halt in King Lathas' and Lord Iorwerth's plans, you solve the intricate light puzzle designed to protect the Death Altar within the temple.

After sealing off the temple and preventing the return of the Dark Lord, it's now time to turn your attention to King Lathas and Lord Iorwerth to end their schemes once and for all in Song of the Elves..
kills: *[[Knight of Ardougne (Song of the Elves)|Knight of Ardougne]] (level 27 and 53)
Song of the Elves.name: Song of the Elves
Song of the Elves.start: Talk to [[Edmond]], who can be found at his home in East Ardougne, north of the [[Flying Horse Inn]].
items: *[[Mourner gear]] including [[gas mask]] ([[plague jacket]] and [[plague trousers|trousers]] do not work)

requirements: The ability to defeat level 45+ enemies.
desc: A rift in the ground has opened up releasing all manner of strange monsters into the lands near the Digsite.
A sorrowful mother waits at the top of the rift for her long lost son, who has been missing for 25 years.
You can journey down into the rift for an adventure full of twisted monsters all created from the mind of a young boy driven to madness through incarceration..
A Soul's Bane.name: A Soul's Bane
A Soul's Bane.start: Go east of [[Varrock]], through the gate by the [[Earth Altar]] and just south of there, speak to [[Launa]].

requirements: *[[File:Magic icon.png|21x21px|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 33 [[Magic]] (boostable)
*[[File:Ranged icon.png|21x21px|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 37 [[Ranged]] (boostable)
*[[File:Mining icon.png|21x21px|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 37 [[Mining]] (boostable)
*[[File:Thieving icon.png|21x21px|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 37 [[Thieving]] (boostable)
desc: The people in the desert village of Nardah have a problem.

Their town well has dried up and any water they try to bring back to the town from the river mysteriously disappears before they can get it back.

The villagers suspect they have been cursed in some way.
Can you unravel what is going on and save the village?.
Spirits of the Elid.name: Spirits of the Elid
items: *Runes for [[Telekinetic Grab]] (One law and air runes)
*[[Bow]] and [[arrow]]s (can be obtained during the quest); a [[crystal bow]] will also work

requirements: *[[File:Quest point icon.png|21x21px|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] 100 [[Quest points]]
*[[File:Magic icon.png|21x21px|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 66 [[Magic]] (boostable)
*[[File:Cooking icon.png|21x21px|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 62 [[Cooking]] (boostable)
*[[File:Fishing icon.png|21x21px|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 62 [[Fishing]] (boostable)
