*[[File:Crafting icon.png|21x21px|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 40 [[Crafting]] (boostable)
*The ability to defeat a [[combat level]] 170 monster, which is able to use [[Magic]], [[Melee]] and can drain [[Prayer]].
desc: Out on the edge of the known world, the Piscatoris Fishing Colony stands on the brink of disaster.
Angry sea trolls are emerging from the sea and attacking the colonists, preventing them from harvesting the valuable monkfish that live in those waters.
A highly experienced adventurer will be needed to drive back the trolls for good.

The Colony's director, Herman Caranos, has a particular adventurer in mind: the notoriously amoral Wise Old Man of Draynor Village (allegations of his involvement in a spectacular bank robbery have never been substantiated).

If you're in the mood for a bit of combat, jump on the boat on the west side of the Gnome Stronghold, speak to the Colony's director and prepare to fight alongside the Wise Old Man as he embarks on his final adventure - his ''swan song''..
kills: *11 [[Sea troll]]s (1 each of levels 65/87/101 and 8 of level 79)
Swan Song.name: Swan Song
Swan Song.start: The [[Piscatoris Fishing Colony]]. It can be reached via a boat trip from the river to the west of the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]].
items: *An [[airtight pot]] – created by using a [[pot lid]] on a [[pot]]
***a [[soft clay]] if making your own pot during quest, or
****a [[pickaxe]] (obtainable during the quest) if mining your own clay during quest
***a [[soft clay]] if making your own pot lid during quest (note: 2 [[soft clay]] needed if making both [[pot]] and [[pot lid]]), or
****a [[pickaxe]] (obtainable during the quest) if mining your own clay during quest
**a [[pickaxe]] (obtainable during the quest) if mining your own iron during quest
*1 set of [[logs]] of any kind, or
**an [[axe]] (obtainable during quest) if chopping your own [[logs]] during quest
*A [[small fishing net]] (given to you during the quest if you do not have one)
*A [[brown apron]] (given to you during the quest if you do not have one)

requirements: * [[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 15 [[Agility]] (boostable)
* [[File:Cooking icon.png|21x21px|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 30 [[Cooking]] (not boostable)
* [[File:Fishing icon.png|21x21px|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 5 [[Fishing]] (boostable) (65 if you wish to catch the [[Raw karambwan]] yourself)
desc:
In Jungle Potion, the Shaman Trufitus communed with the gods to determine the fate of his people.

Now, Timfraku, the Chief of Tai Bwo Wannai, wishes to see his people and family return to the abandoned village.

Help a depressed fisherman, encourage a raging hunter and satiate an eccentric priest in this extreme test of aptitude and patience!.
Tai Bwo Wannai Trio.name: Tai Bwo Wannai Trio
Tai Bwo Wannai Trio.start: Talk to [[Timfraku]] in his house in [[Tai Bwo Wannai]].
items: * [[Knife]] or bladed weapon, such as a [[Sword]]
* [[Sliced banana]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Pestle and mortar]] (can be obtained during the quest for 6 gp)
* [[Iron spear]] or better. Do '''not''' work: [[Black spear]], [[Leaf-bladed spear]], and [[bone spear]]. (The spear will be lost as well.)
* [[Ranged]] or [[Magic]] [[equipment]] to kill a [[monkey]] for a [[monkey corpse]]
* [[Tinderbox]] (If you wish to avoid running back to the range in Brimhaven)
* [[Jogre bones]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Karamjan rum]] or 30 coins to purchase (if obtaining the rum before starting, add the sliced banana or the rum will disappear when you leave the island)

desc:
Missing: small black cat, answers to the name of Bob.

Last seen on the 19th of Bennath.
Please contact Unferth in Burthorpe..
A Tail of Two Cats.name: A Tail of Two Cats
A Tail of Two Cats.start: Talk to [[Unferth]] at his house in [[Burthorpe]].
items: *[[Cat]] or [[kitten]] ([[Hellcat]]s work. Be sure to bring [[fish]] for your kitten if you're using one.)
*[[Desert shirt]] (obtainable during quest) or [[Druid's robe top]] (The [[desert outfit]] does not work)
*[[Desert robe]] (obtainable during quest)  or [[Druid's robe]] (The [[desert outfit]] does not work)

requirements: *[[File:Strength icon.png|21x21px|link=Strength|alt=Strength]] 16 [[Strength]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Mining icon.png|21x21px|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 10 [[Mining]] (not boostable)
desc: Over a thousand years ago, King Shayzien VII ordered an expedition to Mount Quidamortem.
The expedition never returned and it was assumed that all members perished in the field.
However, a recent discovery suggests this may not have been the case.
Phileas Rimor is the descendant of the expedition leader and he is desperate to discover the truth.
Join him and delve into a conspiracy a thousand years in the making in "Tale of the Righteous"..
Tale of the Righteous.name: Tale of the Righteous
Tale of the Righteous.start: Speak to [[Phileas Rimor]] in his house west of [[The Cloak and Stagger]] tavern in [[Shayzien]].
items: *A [[ranged]] weapon with ammunition. Darts and throwing knives also work.
*A [[melee]] weapon of any kind ([[pickaxe]] will work)

requirements: *[[File:Crafting icon.png|21x21px|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 48 [[Crafting]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 45 [[Agility]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Attack icon.png|21x21px|link=Attack|alt=Attack]] 40 [[Attack]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Herblore icon.png|21x21px|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 40 [[Herblore]] (not boostable)
*[[File:Slayer icon.png|21x21px|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 38 [[Slayer]] (not boostable)
desc: For many years, the Myreque have fought back against the reign of the Drakans.
To many, they act as a glimmer of hope in an otherwise miserable existence.
In recent times, the Myreque have been beset by disaster, with numerous members meeting a gruesome end at the hands of Vanstrom Klause, the brutal henchman of the Drakans.
However, while the Myreque may be in their darkest hour, hope still remains.
Thanks to a recent discovery in the laboratories deep beneath Meiyerditch, the Myreque may have finally found a way to take the fight to the vampyres..
A Taste of Hope.name: A Taste of Hope
A Taste of Hope.start: Speak to [[Garth (Theatre of Blood)|Garth]] in [[Ver Sinhaza]] by the entrance to the [[Theatre of Blood]].
items: *1,000 [[coins]] (More if taking [[Andras]]' boat from the [[Ectofuntus]], 10,000 each trip)
**3 [[air rune]]s, 1 [[cosmic rune]] and having your magic set to the [[standard spells|standard Spellbook]]
*[[Rod of ivandis]] (can be obtained during the quest)
*[[Pestle and mortar]] (can be obtained during the quest)

requirements: * [[File:Quest point icon.png|21x21px|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] 43 [[Quest points]]
* [[File:Firemaking icon.png|21x21px|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 49 [[Firemaking]] (boostable)

* [[File:Crafting icon.png|21x21px|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 20 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (adding the sapphire lens to a [[Bullseye lantern (unf)]] is boostable, but [[Bullseye lantern (empty)]] and [[Bullseye lantern]] is not boostable.)
* [[File:Mining icon.png|21x21px|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 20 [[Mining]] (boostable)
desc: Deep in the caves in the [[Lumbridge Swamp]] is an enchanted place where the tears shed by [[Guthix]] when it saw the destruction [[Saradomin]] and [[Zamorak]] had caused with their wars flow from the very walls.
These tears are said to have magical properties to help players gain deeper understanding of the world.
However, the cave is guarded by a loyal serpent named [[Juna]] who blocks passage from everyone.
However, she has grown bored from three thousand years of sitting in the dark cave and wishes to hear stories of life above.
Maybe you could come to some sort of arrangement...?.
Tears of Guthix.name: Tears of Guthix
Tears of Guthix.start: Talk to [[Juna]], deep inside the [[Lumbridge Swamp Caves]].
items: * Lit [[sapphire lantern]] (use a cut [[sapphire]] on a [[bullseye lantern]] or on a [[bullseye lantern (unf)]]), make sure to use a [[tinderbox]] on it as [[Juna]] is busy
** [[Swamp tar]] to fill an empty [[sapphire lantern]] using the [[chemist]] in [[Rimmington]] or the [[lamp still]] in [[Dorgesh-Kaan]]
* [[Rope]] (if you have not yet entered the [[Lumbridge Swamp Caves]])

requirements: * [[File:Thieving icon.png|21x21px|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 42 [[Thieving]] (boostable)
* [[File:Ranged icon.png|21x21px|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 40 [[Ranged]] (Is not a hard requirement as it can be bypassed - See Below )
* The ability to defeat a level 84 enemy with Ranged
desc: A mysterious stranger called Lucien asks you to go on a mission deep under the Temple of Ikov in central Kandarin.
He wants you to retrieve an artefact known as the Staff of Armadyl.
After you retrieve it, the quest doesn't stop there...
Are you on the side of good or evil?.
kills: * [[Guardian of Armadyl]] ''(level 43)'' - only if siding with Lucien
* [[Lucien]] ''(level 14)'' - only if siding with the Guardians of Armadyl
Temple of Ikov.name: Temple of Ikov
Temple of Ikov.start: Speak to [[Lucien]] at the [[Flying Horse Inn]] in the north-west corner of [[East Ardougne]].
items: * Any [[Yew bow|yew]], [[Magic bow|magic]], or [[dark bow]] (must be able to fire [[ice arrows]], so [[crossbows]] won't work!) '''or''' [[darts]] or [[Throwing knife|throwing knives]]

requirements: *[[File:Runecraft icon.png|21x21px|link=Runecraft|alt=Runecraft]] 10 [[Runecraft]] (not boostable)
desc: The Abyss: a deadly realm filled with ancient power.
The secrets of this plane have long eluded the denizens of the Wizards' Tower, though some would give anything to properly uncover them.
One of these wizards is Persten.
While many in the Tower aren't convinced by her unorthodox methods, a recent discovery means she may now hold the key to the knowledge they crave the most.
However, nothing is simple when the Abyss is involved, and Persten won't be able to get to the bottom of her discovery without your help....
Temple of the Eye.name: Temple of the Eye
Temple of the Eye.start: [[Wizard Persten]] north of [[Al Kharid]], near the gate from [[Lumbridge]].

requirements: * [[File:Strength icon.png|21x21px|link=Strength|alt=Strength]] 60 [[Strength]] (not boostable)
* [[File:Slayer icon.png|21x21px|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 56 [[Slayer]] (not boostable)
* [[File:Thieving icon.png|21x21px|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 56 [[Thieving]] (not boostable)
* [[File:Ranged icon.png|21x21px|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 47 [[Ranged]] (not boostable)
* [[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 45 [[Agility]] (not boostable)
desc: King Bolren has a new pet.
Unfortunately, it's another watcher, like the ones unmasked in the Tree Gnome Stronghold during The Eyes of Glouphrie.

Has Glouphrie been watching the Tree Gnome Village, too? If you investigate further you'll find out more about Glouphrie, the history of the gnomes (and their unusual monarchy) and maybe you'll get within a hair's breadth of the lost city of Arposandra....
The Path of Glouphrie.name: The Path of Glouphrie
The Path of Glouphrie.start: Speak to [[King Bolren]] in the [[Tree Gnome Village (location)|Tree Gnome Village]].
items: * [[Key (Tree Gnome Village dungeon)|Tree Gnome Village dungeon key]] (unless [[Roving Elves]] has been started)

desc:
Rumours have been coming back from Miscellania that all is not well, it is said that the king has been turned into a monster!

An exceptional hero is required to investigate.
Experience in ruling kingdoms, wooing royalty and negotiating peace would be an advantage..
Throne of Miscellania.name: Throne of Miscellania
Throne of Miscellania.start: Talk to [[King Vargas]] in the [[Miscellania Castle]]. Take the longboat from [[Rellekka]] to access [[Miscellania]].
items: * [[Logs]] (obtainable during the quest if you bring an axe)

* '''At least one''' of these tools in order to gain favour: A [[pickaxe]], an [[axe]] ''(if 45 [[Woodcutting]])'', a [[rake]] ''(if 10 [[Farming]] and 35 [[Herblore]], obtainable during quest for 15 gp)'', a [[harpoon]] or [[lobster pot]]
* Any non-silver [[ring]] you are willing to lose ''(not [[Onyx ring|onyx]]/[[Dragonstone ring|dragonstone]]/[[Explorer's ring|explorer]]/[[Beacon Ring|beacon]]/[['perfect' ring]])''

* [[Flowers]] you are willing to lose ''(can be bought from [[Flower Girl]] in [[Miscellania]] for 15 [[coins]]; [[trollweiss]], [[marigold]], [[nasturtiums]], and [[white lily]] will not work. You can also plant and pick [[mithril seeds]] if you do not have flowers yet.)''
* '''If seeking the Prince:''' a [[cake]] ([[chocolate cake]]s work too)
* '''If seeking the Princess:''' any [[bow]] (except [[Composite bow|composite]], [[Ogre bow|ogre]], [[Training bow|training]] and [[magic bow]]s!) you are willing to lose

requirements: * [[File:Fletching icon.png|21x21px|link=Fletching|alt=Fletching]] 10 [[Fletching]] (boostable)
* [[File:Smithing icon.png|21x21px|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 20 [[Smithing]] (boostable)
* The ability to defeat a level 47 enemy
desc:
South of Al Kharid a new desert pass has opened up, leading to the dangers of the Kharid desert.
Equip your desert garb and make sure your waterskin is full before heading off into the trackless dunes in search of desert adventure..
The Tourist Trap.name: The Tourist Trap
The Tourist Trap.start: Speak to [[Irena]] by the [[Shantay Pass]], south of [[Al Kharid]].
items: '''Note that all of the required items can be bought from [[Shantay]] at the [[Shantay Pass]].'''

* Full [[Desert clothing]] ([[Desert shirt|shirt]], [[Desert robe|robe]] and [[Desert boots|boots]] required). You '''will''' lose them. (Desert robes, Black desert robe, and Black desert shirt does not work)

* Means to enter the desert. (Such as the [[Shantay pass (item)|Shantay pass]],  [[Desert amulet 2]], [[Teleport tablet]] or [[Teleport scrolls|scrolls]], [[Fairy rings]] or the [[Pharaoh's sceptre]])

requirements: *[[File:Construction icon.png|21x21px|link=Construction|alt=Construction]] 10 [[Construction]] (not boostable)
desc: The construction of a mysterious tower is almost complete, but the builders working on it have gone on strike.
Losing patience, the alchemists that hired them are looking for anybody to help them.
When the world of magic and the world of logic combine you can expect dangerous results, but a true adventurer would cherish such things...
wouldn't they?.
Tower of Life.name: Tower of Life
Tower of Life.start: Talk to [[Effigy]] at the [[Tower of Life (building)|Tower of Life]] just east of the [[Ardougne Monastery]].
items: *[[Beer]] (must be a regular beer - other beers do not work.)

requirements: * The ability to defeat a level 112 [[Khazard warlord]]
desc: The tree gnomes are in trouble.

General Khazard's forces are hunting them to extinction.

Find your way through the hedge maze to the gnomes secret treetop village.

Then help the gnomes fight Khazard and retrieve the orbs of protection..
Tree Gnome Village.name: Tree Gnome Village
Tree Gnome Village.start: Centre of the [[Tree Gnome Village (location)|Tree Gnome Village]] [[Gnome Maze|Maze]], talk to [[King Bolren]].
items: * 6 normal [[logs]] (or an [[axe]], obtainable during the quest by killing [[goblin]]s in the Tree Gnome Village maze)

requirements: * [[File:Thieving icon.png|21x21px|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 21 [[Thieving]] (boostable)
desc: Lord Handelmort of Ardougne is a collector of exotic artefacts.
A recent addition to his private collection is a strange looking totem from Karamja.
The Rantuki tribe are not happy about the recent disappearance of their totem..
Tribal Totem.name: Tribal Totem
Tribal Totem.start: Speak to [[Kangai Mau]] at [[The Shrimp and Parrot]] restaurant in [[Brimhaven]].

requirements: * [[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 28 [[Agility]] (boostable)
* The ability to defeat a level 113 [[Arrg|troll]]
desc: Ug loves Aga, but Aga is together with Arrg.
Since Arrg is a lot stronger than Ug, Ug can't follow the regular mating ritual, which involves ripping the opponent into pieces.
Will you be able to find out what will impress the troll female more than a display of violence? Will you survive the journey to help a lonely troll find love?.
kills: [[Arrg]] ''(level 113)'' ([[safespot]]table; difficult to reach) '''Note:''' This fight is not a safe death.
Troll Romance.name: Troll Romance
Troll Romance.start: Speak to [[Ug]] at the [[Troll Stronghold (location)|Troll Stronghold]].
items: ** A [[bucket of wax]] (use [[insect repellent]] on a beehive followed by a [[bucket]])

requirements: * Completion of [[File:Quest point icon.png|21x21px|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]]  [[Death Plateau]]
* [[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 15 [[Agility]] (boostable) (47 is recommended)
* The ability to defeat a level 113 [[Troll General]] (can be [[safespot]]ted)
desc:
The Imperial Guard raid was a failure, and Dunstan's son has been captured by the trolls!

Journey through Trollheim to the Troll Stronghold, and rescue him!.
kills: * [[Berry]] and [[Twig]] ''(both level 71)'' '''Only''' if you have less than [[File:Thieving icon.png|21x21px|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 30 [[Thieving]] or fail to pickpocket them (can be safespotted)
Troll Stronghold.name: Troll Stronghold

requirements: * [[File:Ranged icon.png|21x21px|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 25 [[Ranged]] (not boostable)
desc: There are rumours of a secret passageway that can be used to get to the other side of the mountains west of Ardougne.
Now it's just a matter of finding it..
Underground Pass.name: Underground Pass
Underground Pass.start: Talk to [[King Lathas]] on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of [[Ardougne Castle]].
items: * 1-5 [[arrows]] (only non-poisoned arrows with metal [[arrowtips]] will work. [[Craw's bow]] does not work. Crossbows and bolts will not work. Broad arrows,  Ogre arrows, and Ice arrows will also not work.)

requirements: Able to defeat a [[combat level]] 34 [[Count Draynor|vampyre]] with a very high health recovery rate.
desc: The people of [[Draynor Village]] live in constant terror.
Their numbers are dwindling, all due to the foul creature lurking in the manor to the north known as a vampyre..
Vampyre Slayer.name: Vampyre Slayer
Vampyre Slayer.start: Speak to [[Morgan]] in his house in [[Draynor Village]], just north of [[Ned]]'s house.
items: *[[Hammer]] (can be bought from the [[general store]] just north of the [[Blue Moon Inn]] for 1 [[coin]])
* [[Beer]] (can be bought during the quest for 2 [[coins]])
* [[Stake]] (obtained from Dr Harlow after giving him a beer)

requirements: *[[File:Quest point icon.png|21x21px|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] 32 [[Quest points]]
*The ability to defeat a level 32 [[Black Knight]].
desc: A wanted man is on the loose.
Can you track him down?.
Wanted!.name: Wanted!
Wanted!.start: Speak to [[Sir Tiffy Cashien]] in [[Falador Park]].
items: *20 un-noted [[Rune essence]] or [[pure essence]] (you'll get them back)
**[[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] The player must deliver all 20 rune essence at once
* [[Light source]] ('''Note:''' [[Candle]]s, [[torch]]es and [[oil lamp]]s can cause [[swamp gas]] explosions if going off-route, and need a tinderbox to stay lit)

requirements: * [[File:Magic icon.png|21x21px|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 14 [[Magic]] (boostable)
* [[File:Thieving icon.png|21x21px|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 15 [[Thieving]] (boostable)
* [[File:Agility icon.png|21x21px|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 25 [[Agility]] (boostable)
* [[File:Herblore icon.png|21x21px|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 14 [[Herblore]] (boostable)
* [[File:Mining icon.png|21x21px|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 40 [[Mining]] (boostable)
* The ability to defeat a level 68 [[Ogre]] and run past level 111 [[Blue dragons]]
desc: The Wizards of the Yanille Watch Tower have been reporting increased ogre sightings recently.
Use a wide variety of your skills to help the wizards recover their stolen power crystals and stop the advance of the ogre hordes!.
kills: * [[Giant bat]] ''(level 27)'' (only if bat bones are needed)
Watchtower.name: Watchtower
Watchtower.start: Begin the quest by speaking to [[Watchtower Wizard]] north of [[Yanille]] in the [[Watchtower (building)|Watchtower]]. You must climb the [[trellis]] on the north side of the tower to get up there for the first time.
items: * [[Death rune]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* 2 [[rope]]s (2nd rope can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Guam potion (unf)]] or [[guam leaf]] and a [[vial of water]] (vial of water can be obtained during quest)
* Any [[light source]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Skavid map]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Pestle and mortar]] (can be obtained during the quest)

* [[Bat bones]] (can be obtained during the quest, a [[knife]] or [[slash weapon]] is needed, grinding the bat bones before starting the quest to leave the pestle and mortar in the bank is also an option)

requirements: * The ability to withstand and evade attacks from level 86 [[Fire Giant]]s and level 84 [[Moss Guardian]] without any equipment.
desc: Investigate the death of elven leaders of old.
Search for the elf King Baxtorian's tomb and discover the mysterious hidden treasure of the waterfall..
Waterfall Quest.name: Waterfall Quest
Waterfall Quest.start: Speak to [[Almera]] in her house north-east of [[Baxtorian Falls]].

requirements: *[[File:Runecraft icon.png|21x21px|link=Runecraft|alt=Runecraft]] 35 [[Runecraft]] (not boostable)
desc: A travelling trader has been stranded south of Varrock after his cart was attacked by local outlaws.

He needs the help of a hero to recover his lost documents, but that's not all...

The Varrock Palace Secret Guard (VPSG) are on the trail of treacherous dealings with the Monks of Zamorak.
Will you be able to help the VPSG and uncover what lies below?.
What Lies Below.name: What Lies Below
items: *Access to the [[Chaos Altar]] ([[Chaos talisman]] or [[Chaos tiara|tiara]], or travelling through the [[Abyss]] or Temple of the Eye) ([[Catalytic talisman]] and [[Catalytic tiara]] will NOT work)

requirements: * The ability to defeat 4 monsters from level 19 to 53 without a break.
desc:
A young boy who lives in Taverley has kicked his ball into the garden of a scary old lady.

He asks you to get it back for him.
This proves more difficult than it first sounds..
Witch's House.name: Witch's House
Witch's House.start: Talk to the [[boy]] near the gate entrance of [[Taverley]].
items: *[[Cheese]] (You may wish to bring several in case you mess up)

desc: Become one with your darker side.
Tap into your hidden depths of magical potential by making a potion with the help of Hetty the Rimmington witch..
Witch's Potion.name: Witch's Potion
Witch's Potion.start: Talk to [[Hetty]] in her house in [[Rimmington]], south of [[Falador]] and west of [[Port Sarim]].
items: *[[Rat's tail]] ''(only obtainable after starting the quest)''

desc: Veos has long been a lover of treasure hunts and his latest hunt has brought him to Lumbridge.
However, not knowing the area well, Veos could use some help finding this treasure..
X Marks the Spot.name: X Marks the Spot
X Marks the Spot.start: Speak to [[Veos]] in [[The Sheared Ram]] in [[Lumbridge]].

requirements: * You must be able to defeat a level 111 enemy.
* [[File:Smithing icon.png|21x21px|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 4 [[Smithing]] (boostable)
* [[File:Herblore icon.png|21x21px|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 8 [[Herblore]] (boostable)
* [[File:Ranged icon.png|21x21px|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 30 [[Ranged]] (not boostable)
desc:
Run for your lives...the zombie ogres are here for your flesh! An ogre ceremonial dance area, used to communicate with ancient ogrish ancestors, has been overrun with diseased undead ogres.

How could something like this have happened? And what sort of rewards could an enterprising adventurer gain from exploring the tombs of such a place?.
Zogre Flesh Eaters.name: Zogre Flesh Eaters
Zogre Flesh Eaters.start: Speak to [[Grish]] in [[Jiggig]], just south of [[Castle Wars]].
items: * 5 free inventory spaces are needed to receive items near the start of the quest
* A [[comp ogre bow]] (not needed if using [[Crumble Undead]]  in final battle) '''or''':
* [[Brutal arrows]] (not needed if using [[Crumble Undead]] in final battle) '''or''':
